RDA_I1_01M.description: The indicator serves to determine that an appropriate standard is used to express knowledge,

evidence.success: Metadata uses knowledge representation expressed in standardised format
evidence.failure: Metadata does not use knowledge representation expressed in standardised format

RDA_I1_01M.info:
More details on RDA Maturity Model specification

.
RDA_I1_01M.hint: Checks metadata terms including controlled vocabulary information. So far, it checks GEONAMES, Library of Congress Subject Headings and ORCID, but it's being extended.

RDA_I1_01D.description: The indicator serves to determine that an appropriate standard is used to express knowledge, in particular the data model and format

evidence.success: Data uses knowledge representation expressed in standardised format
evidence.failure: Data does not use knowledge representation expressed in standardised format

RDA_I1_01D.info:
More details on RDA Maturity Model specification

.
RDA_I1_01D.hint: It checks that data format is within a list of accepted standards. It can be defined by each system/repository within their plugins. The generic plugin accepts: ["pdf", "csv", "jpg", "jpeg", "nc", "hdf", "mp4", "mp3", "wav", "doc", "txt", "xls", "xlsx", "sgy","zip"]

RDA_I1_02M.description: This indicator focuses on the machine-understandability aspect of the metadata

evidence.failure: Metadata does not use machine-understandable knowledge representation

RDA_I1_02M.info:
More details on RDA Maturity Model specification

.
RDA_I1_02M.hint: Checks, via OAI-PMH, if the metadata can be retrieved in a format like RDF

RDA_I1_02D.description: This indicator focuses on the machine-understandability aspect of the data. This means that data should be readable and thus interoperable for machines without any requirements such as specific translators or mapping

evidence.failure: Data does not use machine-understandable knowledge representation

RDA_I1_02D.info:
More details on RDA Maturity Model specification

.
RDA_I1_02D.hint: This test implements the one carried out in RDA-I1-02M. It can be redefined by the plugin

RDA_I2_01M.description: The indicator requires the vocabulary used for the metadata to conform to the FAIR principles, and at least be documented and resolvable using globally unique and persistent identifier

evidence.failure: Metadata does not use FAIR-compliant vocabularies

RDA_I2_01M.info:
More details on RDA Maturity Model specification

.
RDA_I2_01M.hint: If the digital object includes information in a controlled vocabulary, it checks if the controlled vocabulary has a persistent identifier

RDA_I2_01D.description: The indicator requires the controlled vocabulary used for the data to conform to the FAIR principles, and at least be documented and resolvable using globally unique and persistent identifiers

evidence.failure: Data does not use FAIR-compliant vocabularies

RDA_I2_01D.info:
More details on RDA Maturity Model specification

.
RDA_I2_01D.hint: This test implements the one carried out in RDA-I1-01M. It can be redefined by the plugin.

RDA_I3_01M.description: The indicator is about the way that metadata is connected to other metadata, for example through links to information about organisations, people, places, projects or time periods that are related to the digital object that the metadata describes

evidence.success: Metadata includes references to other metadata
evidence.failure: Metadata does not include references to other metadata

RDA_I3_01M.info:
More details on RDA Maturity Model specification

.
RDA_I3_01M.hint: Checks metadata like relation or contributor. Checks ORCID so far.

RDA_I3_01D.description: This indicator is about the way data is connected to other data, for example linking to previous or related research data that provides additional context to the data

evidence.success: Data includes references to other data
evidence.failure: Data does not include references to other data

RDA_I3_01D.info:
More details on RDA Maturity Model specification

.
RDA_I3_01D.hint: This test implements the one carried out in RDA-I3-01M. It can be redefined by the plugin.

RDA_I3_02M.description: This indicator is about the way metadata is connected to other data, for example linking to previous or related research data that provides additional context to the data

evidence.success: Metadata includes references to other data
evidence.failure: Metadata does not include references to other data

RDA_I3_02M.info:
More details on RDA Maturity Model specification

.
RDA_I3_02M.hint: Checks metadata like relation or contributor and also if those links are Persistent identifiers (ORCID for people, DOIs or Handle, etc. for objects, thanks to idutils package)

RDA_I3_02D.description: This indicator is about the way data is connected to other data. The references need to be qualified which means that the relationship role of the related resource is specified, for example that a particular link is a specification of a unit of measurement, or the identification of the sensor with which the measurement was done

evidence.success: Data includes qualified references to other data
evidence.failure: Data does not include qualified references to other data

evidence.failure: Metadata does not include qualified references to other metadata
